means: （用建议、指示、有益的情报等）指导

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"管理，支配"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: control, direct, govern, manage, rule, supervise, administer
means: control ： 含义广泛的常用词，指对人或物施以约束或控制的力量。
direct ： 侧重行使领导或指导权。
govern ： 侧重指运用任何控制的权力来统治或管理一个国家、一个社会或一个部门，暗含能力和知识的运用。
manage ： 强调对具体事务机构进行管理，有时含受权管理或处理之意。
rule ： 强调用绝对或独裁的权力来管理或统治。
supervise ： 侧重指运用本身的或被授予的权力来管理、检查工作，含监督意味。
administer ： 指官方的或正式的对事务的管理。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都含"引导"之意。
means: direct ： 指为某人指方向，但自己不一定亲自引路，也可表示指导一群人的事或活动。
conduct ： 正式用词，指引导某人去某处，强调亲自带领；也强调监督管理一群有共同目的或目标的人。
guide ： 普通用词，可与conduct换用，指引导者与被引导者双方彼此合作，共同努力的关系。
lead ： 指走在前面给某人引路或带路人共同去达到某一目标。用于抽象意义时，指在某项活动或运动中起主导和组织作用。
pilot ： 从原义"为飞机、轮船导航"借喻为指亲自带领某人去某处。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个副词都有"直接地"之意。
means: direct ： 指行路中不停步、不绕道、直奔目的地。
directly ： 指以一种直接的方式。表时间时，指立刻，不拖延之意。

word_mean: 直接的：不用辅助手段的
direct-comparison method of measurement 将被测量直接与已知其值的同类量相比较的测量方法。
direct-comparison weighing 将被称量物体的量直接与已知其值的同类量相比较的称量方法。

sentence.Network_en: All colour fades— especially under the impact of direct sunlight.
sentence.Network_cn: 所有颜色都会褪色——尤其是在阳光直射下。

sentence.Network_en: He has direct experience of the process of privatisation.
sentence.Network_cn: 他对私有化过程有着切身体会。

sentence.Network_en: The direct marketing industry has become adept at packaging special offers.
sentence.Network_cn: 直接邮寄广告业在特卖品的包装方面已经变得非常熟练了。

means.word_mean: 指导;指挥
命令;指示
将...寄给
指挥;管理
指点
其他释义
直接的;率直的
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin directus, past participle of dirigere, from di- 'distinctly' or de- 'down' + regere 'put straight'

encyclopedia.content: 简介 Direct X是图形加速接口，有了这个，应用程序才能更直接的访问硬件资源 DirectX是一种应用程序接口，它可让以windows为平台的游戏或多媒体程序获得更高的执行效率，加强3d图形和声音效果，并提供设计人员一个共同的硬件驱动标准，让游戏开发者不必为每一品牌的硬件来写不同的驱动程序，也降低用户安装及设置硬件的复杂度。这样说是不是有点不太明白，其实从字面意义上说，Direct就是直接的意思，而后边的X则代表了很多的意思

entry.def: Direct means moving towards a place or object, without changing direction and without stopping, for example in a journey.

example.ex: They'd come on a direct flight from Athens.
example.tran: 他们是搭乘从雅典直飞这里的航班过来的。

example.ex: ...the direct route from Amman to Bombay.
example.tran: 从安曼到孟买的直达线路

entry.tran: (光或热)直接照射的，直接接触的
entry.def: If something is in direct heat or light, it is strongly affected by the heat or light, because there is nothing between it and the source of heat or light to protect it.

example.ex: Medicines should be stored away from direct sunlight...
example.tran: 药品的储放应避免阳光直射。

example.ex: Direct illumination is harsh and unflattering.
example.tran: 直射光照明既刺目又呆板。

entry.tran: (经验、活动或系统)直接的，亲身的
entry.def: You use direct to describe an experience, activity, or system which only involves the people, actions, or things that are necessary to make it happen.

example.ex: He has direct experience of the process of privatisation...
example.tran: 他对私有化过程有着切身体会。

example.ex: He seemed to be in direct contact with the Boss...
example.tran: 他似乎直接和老板联系。

entry.def: You use direct to emphasize the closeness of a connection between two things.

example.ex: They were unable to prove that she died as a direct result of his injection...
example.tran: 他们无法证明她的死是由于他的注射直接引起的。

example.ex: His visit is direct evidence of the improvement in their relationship...
example.tran: 他的到访是他们之间关系已有所改善的明证。

entry.tran: 坦率的;率直的;直截了当的
entry.def: If you describe a person or their behaviour as direct, you mean that they are honest and open, and say exactly what they mean.

example.ex: He avoided giving a direct answer...
example.tran: 他避免作出正面回答。

example.ex: The new songs are more direct...
example.tran: 这些新歌听起来更直入人心。

entry.def: If you direct something at a particular thing, you aim or point it at that thing.

example.ex: I directed the extinguisher at the fire without effect...
example.tran: 我把灭火器对准了火焰，但没起作用。

example.ex: He directed the tiny beam of light at the roof.
example.tran: 他把那一小束光对准了屋顶。

entry.tran: 使(注意力、情感、行为等)转向;使…指向;把…引向
entry.def: If your attention, emotions, or actions are directed at a particular person or thing, you are focusing them on that person or thing.

example.ex: The learner's attention needs to be directed to the significant features...
example.tran: 需要将学习者的注意力引向那些着重点上。

example.ex: Do not be surprised if, initially, she directs her anger at you...
example.tran: 如果一上来她就冲你发火，不必惊讶。

entry.tran: 使(话语或眼神)针对，指向，冲…而来
entry.def: If a remark or look is directed at you, someone says something to you or looks at you.

example.ex: She could hardly believe the question was directed towards her...
example.tran: 她很难相信这个问题是冲她来的。

example.ex: The abuse was directed at the TV crews...
example.tran: 这些辱骂是冲着电视台的工作人员来的。

entry.def: If you direct someone somewhere, you tell them how to get there.

example.ex: Could you direct them to Dr Lamont's office, please?...
example.tran: 你能告诉他们去拉蒙特医生的办公室怎么走吗？

example.ex: Inside, a guard directed them to the right.
example.tran: 进去后，一名警卫把他们引向了右边。

entry.def: When someone directs a project or a group of people, they are responsible for organizing the people and activities that are involved.

example.ex: Christopher will direct day-to-day operations.
example.tran: 克里斯托弗将管理日常的运营。

example.ex: ...his coolness in directing the rescue of nine hostages.
example.tran: 在组织解救9名人质的过程中他所表现出的冷静

entry.tran: 导演，执导(电影、戏剧或电视节目)
entry.def: When someone directs a film, play, or television programme, they are responsible for the way in which it is performed and for telling the actors and assistants what to do.

example.ex: He directed various TV shows...
example.tran: 他执导过多种题材的电视节目。

example.ex: The film was directed by Howard Hawks.
example.tran: 该影片是由霍华德·霍克斯导演的。

entry.def: If you are directed to do something, someone in authority tells you to do it.

example.ex: They have been directed to give special attention to the problem of poverty...
example.tran: 他们得到指示要特别关注贫困问题。

example.ex: The Bishop directed the faithful to stay at home.
example.tran: 主教要求信徒们呆在家中。

entry.def: If you are a direct descendant of someone, you are related to them through your parents and your grandparents and so on.

example.ex: She is a direct descendant of Queen Victoria.
example.tran: 她是维多利亚女王的嫡系后代。

means.word_mean: 1. command with authority;

sentences.sentence: "He directed the children to do their homework"

means.word_mean: 2. intend (something) to move towards a certain goal;

sentences.sentence: "He aimed his fists towards his opponent's face"
"direct your anger towards others, not towards yourself"

means.word_mean: 3. guide the actors in (plays and films)
4. be in charge of
5. take somebody somewhere;

sentences.sentence: "can you take me to the main entrance?"

means.word_mean: 6. cause to go somewhere;

sentences.sentence: "The explosion sent the car flying in the air"
"He directed all his energies into his dissertation"

means.word_mean: 7. aim or direct at; as of blows, weapons, or objects such as photographic equipment;

sentences.sentence: "Please don't aim at your little brother!"
"He trained his gun on the burglar"
"Don't train your camera on the women"

means.word_mean: 8. lead, as in the performance of a composition;

sentences.sentence: "conduct an orchestra; Bairenboim conducted the Chicago symphony for years"

means.word_mean: 9. give directions to; point somebody into a certain direction;

sentences.sentence: "I directed them towards the town hall"

means.word_mean: 10. specifically design a product, event, or activity for a certain public
11. direct the course; determine the direction of travelling
12. put an address on (an envelope, for example)
13. plan and direct (a complex undertaking);
1. direct in spatial dimensions; proceeding without deviation or interruption; straight and short;
2. immediate or direct in bearing or force; having nothing intervening;
3. extended senses; direct in means or manner or behavior or language or action;
4. in a straight unbroken line of descent from parent to child;
5. moving from west to east on the celestial sphere; or--for planets--around the sun in the same direction as the Earth
6. similar in nature or effect or relation to another quantity;

sentences.sentence: "a term is in direct proportion to another term if it increases (or decreases) as the other increases (or decreases)"

means.word_mean: 7. of a current flowing in one direction only; not alternating;
8. as an immediate result or consequence;
9. in precisely the same words used by a writer or speaker;
10. effected directly by action of the voters rather than through elected representatives;

sentences.sentence: "many people favor direct election of the President rather than election by the Electoral College"

means.word_mean: 11. exact;
1. without deviation;

sentences.sentence: "the path leads directly to the lake"

auth_sentence.content: So has the increased number of direct flights in.
auth_sentence.res_content: So has the increased number of direct flights in.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So has the increased number of direct flights in.

auth_sentence.content: That could take the form of a direct payment.
auth_sentence.res_content: That could take the form of a direct payment.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That could take the form of a direct payment.

auth_sentence.content: There's probably not all that much direct danger.
auth_sentence.res_content: There's probably not all that much direct danger.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There's probably not all that much direct danger.

stems_affixes.word_buile: in不+direct直接的→adj.间接的, 迂回的
di离开+rect正,直→直接离开→径直的→指向，针对→管理，指导
direct直接的+ly表副词→adv.直接地, 立即
correct[v.改正,纠正]+itude状态→纠正后的状态
correct[v.改正,纠正]+ive表名词→n.矫正物, 中和物

stems_affixes.value_cn: 方向, 指导, 趋势
stems_affixes.word_buile: direct直接的;指导;指向+ion动作或状态→n.方向, 指导, 趋势

stems_affixes.value_cn: 主任, 主管, 导演
stems_affixes.word_buile: direct直接的+or人或物器→n.主任, 主管, 导演
rect正,直+angle角→[四个角]都是直角→矩形
rect正,直+itude状态→正直的状态→诚实,正直
di离开+rect正,直→直接离开→径直的→指向，针对→管理，指导
rect正,直+ify……化→使……正直→改正[错误]

abbreviation.mean_cn: 地址姓名录；工商行名录

Sentence.sentence: They are owned by individuals and by private businesses and corporations, lending institutions, direct mailing and telemarketing firms, credit bureaus, credit card companies, and government agencies at the local, state, and federal level.
More than half of their time is spent directing traffic and writing parking tickets.
So just take the fastest way even if it's not the most direct.
Reinforcement occurs when we receive direct or indirect rewards or punishments for particular gender role behaviors.
We learn from Paragraph 2 that reinforcement, whether direct or indirect, can help increase children's awareness of gender roles
Yet until recently the worst forecasts were almost exclusively linked to direct human activity, such as clear-cutting and burning for pastures or farms.

means.word_mean: 直的, 笔直的, 径直的

sentences.en: This is the most direct road.
sentences.cn: 这是最直的一条路。

sentences.en: This train is direct, you do not have to change.
sentences.cn: 这辆火车是直达的, 你不必换车。

means.word_mean: 直接的, 直系的

sentences.en: I'm in direct contact with the hijackers.
sentences.cn: 我与劫机者保持着直接的联系。

sentences.en: They were the direct descendants of the Dutch settlers.
sentences.cn: 他们是荷兰移民的直系后裔。

means.word_mean: 率直的, 坦率的, 坦白的

sentences.en: She has a direct way of speaking.
sentences.cn: 她说话直爽。

sentences.en: He is very direct, so you always know what his real views are.
sentences.cn: 他为人很直率, 所以你总能知道他的真实想法。

means.word_mean: 恰好的, 完全的

sentences.en: Your reply today is in direct contradiction to what you said last week.
sentences.cn: 你今天的答复跟上星期说的恰好相反。

means.word_mean: 径直地, 笔直地

sentences.en: The road leads direct there.
sentences.cn: 这条路直通那儿。

means.word_mean: 直接地, 亲自地

sentences.en: The teacher suggested that I write him direct.
sentences.cn: 老师建议我直接写信给他。

sentences.en: The mayor goes direct to the people to listen to their complaints.
sentences.cn: 市长亲自深入群众倾听他们的怨言。

means.word_mean: 指示方向, 指引

sentences.en: Sign posts direct travelers.
sentences.cn: 路标给游客指路。

means.word_mean: 在…上写姓名和地址

sentences.en: The parcel was directed to the wrong address.
sentences.cn: 这邮包被寄错了。

means.word_mean: (用建议、指示、有益的情报等)指导，引导，指引，带领

sentences.en: The general manager directed the company through a difficult time.
sentences.cn: 总经理带领公司渡过了难关。

means.word_mean: 规定…的方向；控制；操纵

sentences.en: History is directed by a small number of great figures.
sentences.cn: 历史是由少数伟大人物指引着方向的。

means.word_mean: 使向某个方向(或目标)移动(at，against，to，towards)

sentences.en: We directed radio waves around the globe.
sentences.cn: 我们向全球发射无线电波。

means.word_mean: 把(时间、精力、目光等)对准某一目标(或方向)，使…前朝某一目标(或结果)采取行动(或努力)(常与to或towards连用)

sentences.en: He directed all his energies to the task.
sentences.cn: 他把全部精力都用于这项任务上。

means.word_mean: 针对某人(或某些人)说(话)，对(某人)讲(话)；提出(要求、意见等)；做出(手势、面部表情等)(against，at，to，towards)

sentences.en: He directed his remarks to the secretary.
sentences.cn: 他的话是对秘书说的。

means.word_mean: 指导, 导演, 管理

sentences.en: Who will direct at the concert?
sentences.cn: 音乐会谁来指挥?

sentences.en: Thinking directs one's actions.
sentences.cn: 思想指导行动。

sentences.en: The general directed that the prisoners should be set free.
sentences.cn: 将军命令释放囚犯。

sentences.en: I directed him to do the work.
sentences.cn: 我命令他去做这项工作。

jushi.chinese: 昨晚的音乐会是谁指挥的?

jushi.english: Who will direct at the concert?
